channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tourism revenue drops in Greece despite sharp summer tourism crunch
item.description: Industry revenue fell by 1.8 percent compared to last year even as the number of tourists grew by 6.6 percent.

item.title: HSBC Announces Restructuring and Names First Female C.F.O.
item.description: The restructuring of Europe’s largest lender comes as it looks to cut costs and navigate a diplomatic minefield across its sprawling operations.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Live Updates: Blinken Visits Israel After Hezbollah Missiles Target Tel Aviv
item.description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken met with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in the latest U.S. effort to calm hostilities in the Middle East.

item.title: Polymarket tilts toward a Donald Trump victory in the election—but how accurate is it?
item.description: Polymarket odds offer a useful gauge for predicting the upcoming election, but there are significant caveats.

item.title: America’s Flooding Problem
item.description: We explain how the country is responding in three different ways to disasters.

item.title: Israeli Military Strikes Near Hospital Bordering Beirut
item.description: Officials said the attack damaged Rafik Hariri University Hospital, the largest public health facility in Lebanon.

item.title: Hugh Hefner’s youngest son attempts to buy back the Playboy brand
item.description: Cooper Hefner bids $100 million for the company, nearly twice its market cap.

item.title: Party barns are the hottest amenity for U.K.’s countryside rich
item.description: Wealthy homeowners are spending upwards of £200,000 ($260,000) to turn drafty disused agricultural spaces into the ideal hangout for a raucous dinner ...

item.title: This N.Y.C. Theater Was a Haven for Adventurous Art. Then the Archdiocese Intervened.
item.description: The Connelly Theater has suspended operations after its church landlord began more carefully scrutinizing show scripts and its general manager resigne...

item.title: What’s Wrong With Donald Trump?
item.description: I think there’s an answer. But it’s not age — or, at least, it’s not just age.

item.title: Warren Buffett warns of ‘casino-like’ investor behavior. Here’s the hidden cost of ‘free’ investing
item.description: In today's "free" investing world, investors get distracted away from seeking the portfolio with the highest return-to-risk ratio possible.

item.title: Why Sara Duterte Talked About Beheading Ferdinand Marcos Jr.
item.description: The alliance between Sara Duterte and President Ferdinand R. Marcos Jr., which brought two notorious dynasties together, has unraveled in spectacular ...

item.title: At the Scene In Beirut After Israel’s Overnight Strike Near a Hospital
item.description: As search teams combed the ruins of residential buildings across from Rafik Hariri University Hospital just south of Lebanon’s capital, locals listene...

item.title: In a Malaysian Pop-Up City, Echoes of China’s Housing Crash
item.description: Forest City was an audacious $100 billion project by a top Chinese developer. Today, the project is a fraction of what had been planned and the develo...

item.title: I.M.F. Says Inflation Fight Is Largely Over but Warns of New Threats
item.description: The International Monetary Fund said protectionism and new trade wars could weigh on growth.
